history.content: I have taken 161 and am currently in 194-34 and I would say there's very little overlap in terms of cryptography. What knowledge are you looking for? The main focus of 161 is learning how various primitives/protocols (block ciphers/PKE/TLS etc.) work and how to use them correctly. 194-34 (soon to be CS171 I believe) is much more theoretical and focuses on actually proving that stuff is secure.

As title, I wish to sincerely ask about how much cryptography does CS 161 cover. I checked the website of 161, but since I don't know much about cryptography, I can't gauge the content by myself. I am asking because I heard there is CS 194-31, which digs into cryptography. I want to check if I need to take 194-31, or I can learn most of the materials that are crucial in cryptography by 161.

Thank you all so much!
history.subject: How much cryptography does 161 cover?
